**The Supreme Numinous Treasure: Catalog of Sacred Fungi**

*Scripture Title:* The Supreme Numinous Treasure: Catalog of Sacred Fungi. Author unknown, likely composed during the Northern and Southern Dynasties or the Sui-Tang period. Not recorded in the *Lingbao Scripture Catalog*. One scroll. Source text: *Zhengtong Daoist Canon*, Orthodox Section, Part One.

**The Supreme Numinous Treasure: Catalog of Sacred Fungi**

The art of prolonging life fundamentally relies upon consuming elixirs to attain longevity. As the *Book of Hidden Marvels* states: "The immortals command spirits." Thus, Guangchengzi dwelled upon Mount Kongtong, revealing the Dao and its governance to the Yellow Emperor. Chisongzi ascended the Kunlun Palace, ingesting *shuiyu* (water jade) to instruct the Flame Emperor. They roamed with wind and rain, ascending and descending to investigate subtle omens, traversing famous mountains, and observing flora—unveiling the mysteries of the obscure.

The forms of sacred fungi (*zhi*) are manifold, their myriad manifestations difficult to distinguish. Thus, illustrations were drawn, their appearances recorded, and their descriptions transmitted, that seekers might follow them to attain the path of immortality.

**Azure Jade Fungus** grows upon the mountains of Yangzhou. Its flavor is sweet and sour; consuming it grants twelve myriad years of life. Wang Ziqiao ate it and ascended as an immortal. A green tiger guards it. According to the illustration, it has four layers, with two branches on the second layer—its stem and cap are entirely azure.

**Cinnabar Jade Fungus** (also called *Zishi Fungus*) grows upon the mountains of Yuzhou. Its form is as depicted, and its flavor is bitter. Chisongzi consumed it and attained immortality. A red tiger and red fish guard it. According to the illustration, its stem and cap are crimson, with two layers. The lower layer bears two small fungi, and the upper layer has two small fungi, each with a cap.

**Yellow Jade Fungus** grows upon Mount Penglai. Its color is yellow, and its flavor is pungent. The Eastern King Father consumed it, attaining ninety thousand years of life and immortality. A yellow tiger and yellow fish guard it. It has three layers; the lower layer bears three branches, one of which produces nine caps. Its stem and cap are entirely yellow.

**White Jade Fungus** grows within Mount Fangzhang. Its flavor is pungent and white. It has four layers; on the lowest layer, two grow upward, and three grow upon the upper layer. It may also sprout upon great stones, in yellow sands, at the roots of rotting wood, beneath tall trees, or on the shady sides of famous mountains. Consuming it grants immortality. A white tiger guards it.

**Black Jade Fungus** grows within Mount Gui. Its flavor is sweet and sour. Xianyuzi consumed it and attained immortality. A black tiger guards it nearby, its form as depicted. It has two small branches growing in layers, its color black, with four layers—its stem and cap are both crimson.

**Five Thearchs’ Jade Fungus** grows within the renowned mountains of Songgao. It possesses five colors and five transformations corresponding to the Five Phases. Its flavor changes with the four seasons. Consuming it in accordance with the seasons grants ten thousand years of immortality. It has three layers; the lower two layers bear two opposing branches.

**Azure Thearch’s Jade Fungus** grows beneath great trees in famous mountains, veiled by yellow clouds. Its cap is azure, its lining crimson, its stem white, and its flavor sour. Harvested on *jiayi* days in spring and consumed, it grants ageless immortality.

**Cinnabar Thearch’s Jade Fungus** grows on the sunny sides of famous mountains. Its cap is crimson, its lining yellow, and its stem white. Red clouds hover above it, and its flavor is sweet and bitter. Harvested in summer and consumed, it grants four thousand years of immortality.

**Yellow Thearch’s Jade Fungus** grows atop famous mountains, above which five-colored clouds appear. Its cap is yellow, its stem white, and its flavor sweet and bitter. Consuming it banishes fear and grants thirty thousand years of life, attaining immortality.

**White Thearch’s Jade Fungus** grows between layered stones on the sunny sides of famous mountains. Its cap is white, its stem azure, and its lining black, with a sweet flavor. Consuming it grants three thousand years of immortality.

**Black Thearch’s Jade Fungus** grows within great valleys on the shady sides of famous mountains, veiled by black clouds. Its cap is black, its lining azure, and its stem yellow, with a sweet and sour flavor. Harvested in winter and consumed, it prevents aging and grants immortality.

**Eastern Fungus** grows within great valleys on the sunny sides of famous mountains. Its lining is azure and crimson, with two layers and a white cap. Its stem is azure, and its flavor is sour. Consuming it extends life to ten myriad years of immortality.

**Southern Fungus** grows on the sunny sides of famous mountains. It is crimson, with a crimson cap and stem, bearing three branches. Its flavor is bitter. Harvested with a bamboo knife, dried in the shade for a hundred days, and consumed in coin-sized portions, it grants thirty thousand years of immortality.

**Central Fungus** grows on the shady sides of famous mountains. Its cap is white, its stem yellow, and its lining black. Its branches resemble a single stem with a cap, two branches at the midpoint, their tips curling downward like suspended canopies. A yellow ram guards it. Harvested with a wooden knife and consumed, it grants immortality.

**Western Fungus** grows on the shady sides of famous mountains. Its cap is white, its lining black, and its stem azure, with three branches growing together. Its flavor is sweet and pungent. Consuming it grants ten thousand years of immortality.

**Northern Fungus** grows on the shady sides of famous mountains. Its cap is black, with three branches growing together from the stem. Its flavor is sweet and pleasant. Consuming it grants immortality—one who eats it will not drown in water, will not age, and will attain eighty myriad years of life. A black ox guards it.

**Stone Mortar Fungus** grows upon Mount Shaoshi, beneath red clouds, with yellow tigers guarding it on both sides. Its cap is crimson, its stem black, and it grows opposite the *Stone Jade Fungus*. To harvest it, one must fast and bathe for thirty days. When a rooster crows at dawn, the gatherer declares themselves *Tianzhai Jiangjun* (Heavenly Fasting General), dons colorful robes, and wears a dark crown and sash. Consuming a single *ge* (measure) grants sixty myriad years of life. (Alternatively, sixteen myriad years.)

**Growing between great stones**, its flavor is sweet and tart, its lower roots square, and it stands three *chi* tall.

**Wood Spirit Fungus** grows upon the northern slopes of Mount Songgao. Its cap is yellow with a black underside, and above it hover red clouds with vermilion sparrows guarding it. Harvested on a *wu* or *ji* day of the sixth month and consumed, it grants nine thousand years of life, rendering one immortal. Its form resembles a square stone with a single flat surface.

**Ghost Mushroom Fungus** grows upon the northern slopes of renowned mountains. Its cap is white, shaped like a steamer, and two ghosts guard it—vanishing at the sight of humans. Gathered at night and dried in the shade for a hundred days, consuming a *daogui* (measure) ensures all before one submit. The Weaving Maiden consumed it and ascended to heaven as an immortal.

**Human Might Fungus** grows upon the mountains of Songgao, Shaoshi, and Taishi. It resembles a human figure, crimson in hue, crowned with a cap that shifts between yellow and red, and tastes sweet. Consuming it prevents aging, and partaking of it grants eighty myriad years of immortal life.

**Golden Essence Fungus** grows upon Mount Hua. Its cap is white, its stem wreathed in white clouds, and it resembles a young pheasant. Its flavor is sweet and pungent. Harvested on a *ren* day of the tenth month, dried in the shade for a hundred days, and consumed, it grants eight thousand years of life.

Han Zhong consumed it and ascended as an immortal.

**Yellow Fungus** grows upon Mount Huangtu, its yellow cap layered thrice, its flavor sweet. Consuming it grants life equal to heaven and earth. Its stem is white.

**Golden-Born Fungus** grows upon the southern slopes of renowned mountains, its cap white, its lining red, its stem crimson. Harvested in spring or summer, dried in the shade for a hundred days, and consumed in a *ge* (measure), it cures yin ailments and extends lifespan.

**Tortoise Might Fungus** grows within the deep abysses of Mount Chang, its hue blue-black, its cap marked with tortoise patterns, wrapped in blue-white, its stem black, its flavor sour and bitter. Harvested and consumed, it grants ten thousand years of immortal life.

**Dragon Might Fungus** grows upon the northern slopes of Mount Tai, its stem blue, its cap purple, its lining white, its patterns resembling dragons and serpents, its flavor sweet and sour. Harvested in spring and consumed, it grants one hundred sixty thousand years of immortal life.

**Bird Might Fungus** grows upon the northern slopes of the southern mountains of Mount Heng, its cap crimson, its stem black, its flavor sour. Consuming it lightens the body and grants ten thousand years of immortal life without aging.

**Fire Essence Fungus** grows upon the northern slopes of Mount Huo, its cap crimson, its lining yellow, its stem yellow. Above it drift red clouds resembling a pheasant. Harvested on a *bingwu* day of the fifth month and consumed, it grants nine thousand years of immortal life.

**Fire Tin Fungus** grows beside great trees on the southern slopes of renowned mountains, its hue fiery red, its stem blue, its cap crimson, flames rising from its five branches like fire, its flavor sweet and bitter. Harvested in summer and consumed, it extends lifespan and grants immortal life.

**Master Red Pine’s Fungus** grows amid thousand-year-old pines upon Mount Yuan, resembling a wooden figure. Harvested, dried in the shade for a hundred days, and consumed, it grants life equal to heaven and earth as an immortal.

**Wood Essence Fungus** grows within renowned mountains, its woody base resembling a spinning wheel in winter. Gathered at any time, its color is white, its flavor sweet and bitter. Consuming it lightens the body and grants immortal life. Its capless form resembles a fork, its stem crimson.

**Wood Spirit Fungus** grows upon Mount Tai of Qi, known as the Eastern Peak, its cap blue, its lining red, its stem crimson, above it drift blue clouds resembling a chicken. Harvested on a *ren* day and consumed, it grants ten million years of immortal life.

**Heaven’s Eye Fungus** grows upon the southern slopes of renowned mountains, its color blue, its stem bifurcated midway, its upper branches curved like an inverted cap, red, covering a larger cap. Harvested with a bamboo knife, dried in the shade for a hundred days, and consumed, it grants fifty thousand years of immortal life, veiled by black clouds.

**Heaven’s Heart Fungus** grows upon the southern slopes of renowned mountains, nestled between stones, its cap blue, its stem red, its flavor sour. Harvested with a bamboo knife, dried in the shade for a hundred days, and consumed in the measure of a fingernail, it grants three thousand years of immortal life. Above it drift red clouds, below it a white ram stands guard.

**White Bloom Fungus** grows upon the southern slopes of Mount Tai, its hue blue, its five stems branching in pairs. Sweet and delightful, consuming it grants ten thousand years of immortal life.

**Water Spirit Fungus** grows upon Mount Heng, its cap black, its stem blue, above it drift black clouds resembling a horse. Harvested and consumed, it grants six thousand years of immortal life.

**Earth Fungus** grows within great marshes on the southern slopes of renowned mountains, its white cap resembling porcelain, its flavor pungent and bitter. Consuming it ensures neither cold nor heat; harvested in summer and consumed, it grants immortal life.

**Jade Gazing Fungus** grows within the northern ridges of renowned mountains, its cap yellow, its stem red, its flavor sweet. Consuming it grants two thousand years of immortal life. Below, three stems grow together, their caps blue, their stems red. Above, two stems rise, their caps yellow, their stems red.

**Wood Vein Fungus** grows within renowned mountains, its upper part blue, its lining yellow, its flavor sweet and sour. Harvested in spring and consumed, it grants seven hundred years of immortal life without aging.

**Bronze Fungus** grows within deep valleys and springs on the northern slopes of renowned mountains, inverted like a steamer, its color blue-yellow-red, its flavor pungent and bitter. Consuming a *ge* (measure) grants eternal life as an immortal.

**Heaven’s Crimson Fungus** grows within hills and valleys, its cap black, its lining red, its stem red, its flavor sweet with a hint of pungency. Consuming it ensures neither cold nor heat, granting six thousand years of immortal life.

**Poria Fungus** grows beneath dodder on the winter solstice, resembling an ox’s hoof, its color black, its flavor sweet. Consuming it allows one to see objects a thousand *li* away and grants ten thousand years of immortal life.

**Northern Fungus** grows upon earthen mountains, resembling a snake, its color crimson, its lining white, its flavor sweet and sour. Consuming it grants twenty thousand years of immortal life without aging.

**Wood Mushroom Fungus** grows upon trees within northern valleys of renowned mountains, sprouting from three knots in the wood, its color blue, its flavor sweet and pungent. Consuming it grants ten thousand years of immortal life.

**Wind Essence Fungus** grows within renowned mountains, its cap blue, its three stems growing together, its flavor sweet. Harvested with a bronze knife and consumed, it grants ten thousand years of immortal life.

**Spirit Essence Fungus** grows upon the northern slopes of renowned mountains, its cap crimson, its two layers of stem purple. Consuming it grants twenty thousand years of immortal life, guarded above by dark ochre clouds.

**Bird Vein Fungus** bears a white cap, a black stem, its lining marked with patterns six *chi* long and four *cun* thick, its flavor sweet. Consuming it grants forty thousand years of immortal life.

**Jade Mushroom Fungus** grows upon the southern slopes of renowned mountains. Harvested in mid and late summer, dried in the shade for a hundred days, and consumed, it grants one hundred thousand years of immortal life.

**Dusk Essence Fungus**, resembling the **Night Essence Fungus**, its face red, its lower part yellow-white, its stem vermilion, its cap crimson, growing inverted. **Day Essence Fungus** grows in autumn upon the southern slopes of renowned mountains, its color crimson, its two stems growing together. Harvested with a wooden knife, dried in the shade for a hundred days, and consumed in a *ge* (measure), it grants thirty thousand years of life. Its stem and cap are both crimson.

**Night Essence Fungus** grows upon the northern slopes of renowned mountains, its hue blue-green, its stem blue, its flavor sour, its cap inverted outward, bearing dew. Drinking it grants thirty thousand years of life.

**White Jade Fungus** grows within the valleys of Mount Tai, its leaves blue, its lower part red, each side layered thrice with crimson stems.

Harvested and consumed, it grants eighty thousand years of life. **Dawn Essence Fungus** grows in summer. White in color, capless, square like stone, its flavor bitter. Harvested with a bronze knife, dried in the shade for a hundred days, and consumed, it grants ten thousand years of immortality. Two persons guard it above.

**Spring Essence Fungus** is blue-green and red, its cap inverted, bearing horns, with two seeds hanging downward, its flavor bitter. Harvested with a bronze knife, regardless of quantity, and consumed, it grants thirty thousand years of life. Five-colored clouds cover it.

**Earth Fungus** displays five hues—now yellow, now blue-green, now red, now white, now black—with three branches bearing seeds. Consumed, it extends life and grants immortality.

**Wood Fungus Yellow Essence** grows within great stones. Its leaves span two *cun* in width and one *chi* in length, blue-green in color, three leaves growing together, its base square like stone. It grows in winter and summer, its flavor sweet and pleasant. Consumed, it grants ageless immortality.

**Summer Essence Fungus** grows within renowned mountains. Its cap is red, bearing two seed-like pearls within, its flavor sweet. Harvested with a bamboo knife, dried in the shade for a hundred days, and consumed, it grants forty thousand years of immortality.

**Autumn Essence Fungus** grows within sunken hollows, surrounded by many fragrant herbs. Its cap is yellow, its interior red, three crooked branches growing together, their heads drooping, their stems blue-green. Consumed, it grants ten thousand years of life.

**White Cloud Fungus** displays five colors, round like a drum, bearing six red seeds above. Its stem is also red, its flavor sour. Consumed, it grants ten thousand years of immortality.

**Left Spirit Fungus** has a black cap facing upward toward the sky, a white stem, and is guarded by a woman. Drinking the dew within grants two thousand years of life. It grows within renowned mountains.

**Right Spirit Fungus** grows within renowned mountains. Its cap is blue-green, its stem white, with three branches. Harvested with a bone knife, dried in the shade for a hundred days, and consumed in the amount of a melon seed, it grants ten thousand years of life. A white deer guards it below.

**Wood Fortune Fungus** is blue-green, bearing branch-like veins, growing within renowned mountains, its flavor sweet. Consumed, it grants ten thousand years of life. It has five stems and a blue-green cap.

**Stone Fungus** grows within renowned mountains. It emits light at night. Harvested at noon on a summer day, the red central portion is consumed, granting ten thousand years of immortality. Its stem is white, its head resembling a lotus.

**Red Jade Fungus** grows within renowned mountains. Its cap is white, its interior veined, its stem blue-green, its flavor pungent. Consumed, it prevents aging, and two hundred spirits follow the immortal.

**Iron Essence Fungus** grows in autumn. Its cap is purple, its interior yellow, with five branches, its flavor sweet. Harvested with a bronze knife and consumed in the amount of a wood ear, it grants three thousand years of immortality. Five-colored clouds cover it above.

**Branch Essence Fungus** grows upon the northern slopes of renowned mountains. Its cap is white, its stem white. Harvested with a wooden knife, dried in the shade for a hundred days, and consumed in the amount of a bean, it grants ten thousand years of immortality. Only the yellow central portion is edible.

**Earth Fungus** grows within renowned mountains. Its cap is blue-green, its stem white. Consumed, it grants ten thousand years of immortality.

**Stone Essence** grows within renowned mountains. Its cap is white, its stem white. Consumed, it grants sixty thousand years of immortality. A *fangcun* (square *cun*) is taken thrice daily.

**Stone Essence Fungus** grows in autumn. Its cap is red, its interior white, its stem red, its flavor sour. Consumed, it grants ten thousand years of immortality. A red bird guards it above.

**River-Sealed Fungus** grows in autumn. Yellow in color, three branches growing together. Drinking the dew upon it grants nine thousand years of immortality. Its cap faces upward.

**Water Fungus** has a blue-green cap, a white interior, and a blue-green stem. Consumed daily in the amount of a *ge*, it cures illness and grants ten thousand years of immortality.

**Beast Fungus** grows beneath pine and cypress trees in renowned mountains. Its cap is white, its stem white. Harvested on the Summer Solstice, one *ge* is taken daily. After three years, one transforms and attains immortality.

**Sea Gate Fungus** grows upon sand and stone in autumn. Four-layered, resembling a cap, blue-green in color, its stem red, two branches growing together. Drinking the dew upon it grants ten thousand years of immortality. Five-colored clouds cover it above.

**Cloud Jade Fungus** grows in late autumn. Its stem is blue-green, its leaves blue-green, and a white bird guards it above. Drinking the dew upon it grants one thousand years of immortality.

**Blue-Green Fungus** has a double-layered blue-green cap, a white interior, a white stem, its flavor sweet and sour. Consumed daily in the amount of a *ge*, it grants one thousand years of immortality.

**Cloud Fungus** has a blue-green cap, a yellow stem, its flavor like honey. Consumed, it grants one thousand years of immortality. Five-colored clouds cover it above.

**Kunlun Fungus** grows in autumn. Its cap is double-layered yellow, its stem yellow, its flavor sweet. Drinking the dew upon it grants three thousand years of immortality.

**Human Essence Fungus** grows within renowned mountains. Its head is blue-green, its cap white, its interior red, three branches growing together, its flavor sweet. Drinking the dew upon it grants ten thousand years of immortality.

**Mountain Glory Fungus** grows in the deep, shady, damp cliffs of renowned peaks. Red in color, resembling a four-tiered pagoda. Consumed, it grants one thousand years of immortality.

**Purple Fungus** resembles a human head, its flavor pungent. Consumed, it sharpens the mind, prevents death, and lightens the body.

**Winter Willow Fungus** grows in autumn upon the southern slopes of Mount Tai. Its cap is yellow, with three yellow stems, its roots distinct yet sharing the same cap, its flavor sweet and pungent. Dried in the shade for a hundred days and consumed, it grants two thousand years of immortality.

**Red Essence Fungus** grows in summer. Its cap is yellow, its stem blue-green, its interior white, with nine double layers. Consumed, it grants five thousand years of immortality. Five-colored grasses grow on either side.

**Purple Stone Fungus** has a bitter flavor, a red cap, a yellow interior, and a red stem. Consumed, it grants deathless immortality.

**Purple Cap Fungus** has three stems sharing a single base, its cap square and purple, two *chi* in size, its flavor sweet. Consumed, it grants three thousand years of immortality.

**Red Essence Fungus** is red and flaming, its flavor sweet. Harvested with an iron knife, dried in the shade for a hundred days, and consumed, it grants two thousand years of immortality. Two persons guard it, resembling torches of fire. Its stem and flames are both red.

**Mountain-Welcoming Connected Fungus**—consumed, it enables one to walk a thousand *li* in a day and grants eight thousand years of immortality. It has three stems sharing a single root, the central stem bearing a cap, all purple in color, while the two lower stems lack caps.

**Purple Mountain Fungus** is deep purple-red, with four layers and a red cap. Consumed, it grants three thousand years of immortality.

**Purple Fungus** has a white cap, a yellow interior, and resembles the moon, with a white stem. Consumed, it bestows luminous immortality.

**Wood Fungus**—consumed, it grants a thousand years of immortality.
**Water Fungus**—consumed, it grants a thousand years of immortality. It resembles the character *wang* in shape.

**Double-Purple Fungus** has a yellow cap, a red stem, and two stems growing conjoined. Consumed, it grants immortality.

**Six-Pillar Purple Fungus** has a red cap, a red stem, and a yellow sheath. Consumed, it confers immortality. Its top bears a cap, while the lower three layers lack one.

**Purple-Stalk Fungus** is red, with a white interior, resembling a snake, and has a bitter flavor. It dispels cold-heat pathogenic qi; consuming one *ge* daily grants immortality. Harvested in autumn.

**Purple Fungus** has a sweet flavor, a white cap, three stems, and a stem that is yellow above and red below. Consumed, it grants immortality, filling the bones and body with solidity and transforming the intestines into sinew. Its top bears a cap, while the lower layer lacks one.

**Double-Purple Fungus** resembles the above in form, with a sweet-bitter flavor. Consumed, it grants immortality. Its white cap rises upward, with a yellow stem, a red root, three stems, a cap on top, and two lower stems lacking caps.

**Purple Fungus** has a red cap, a white interior, a red stem, and a sweet flavor. Consumed, it extends lifespan and grants immortality.

**Stalk Fungus** has a red exterior, a white sheath, and a sweet flavor. Consumed in winter, it prevents aging and grants immortality, resembling a snake’s tail.

**Purple Fungus** has a red cap, a white interior, a black stem, and a sweet flavor. Harvested and consumed in autumn, it grants immortality.

**Fire Fungus** has a red cap, a white interior, a black stem, and a bitter flavor. Harvested and consumed in winter or summer, it grants immortality. Five-colored clouds cover it above, with two stems growing in crossed formation.

**Stalk Fungus** has three layers, is red, with a white cap, and a sweet-spicy flavor. Consumed, it extends lifespan and grants immortality.

**Water Fungus** has a red cap, a white interior, and a white stem. Three stems emerge upward to form a cap. Consumed, it extends lifespan and grants immortality.

**Palace Fungus**—consumed, it extends lifespan and prevents aging, granting immortality.

In total, there are eleven sections.

**Vermilion-Capped Fungus** has a red cap and a red stem.
**Gate Fungus**—harvested in summer or autumn, consuming a *cun*-square piece daily grants a lifespan equal to heaven and earth. It has a purple cap and a purple stem, in seven segments, with the central stem longer and two caps resembling pearl wheels.

**Upper Fortune Fungus**—consumed, it grants immortality, allowing one to travel through the void. It has a green cap and a vermilion stem, in eleven segments: six above, two in the middle, and three below.

**Jade Essence Fungus** grows in the great sea, with a sweet flavor. Consumed, it grants two thousand years of immortality. It has a vermilion cap and a jade stem, both vermilion in color.

**Marquis-Substituting Fungus** is round above and square below. Harvested in spring (or the fifth month), consuming it grants a lifespan of ten thousand years. It resembles a vermilion barrel.

**Cloud Fungus**—consumed for six years, red clouds guard it above. It has a vermilion cap, vermilion stem, and vermilion leaves, with six leaves.

**Deathless Fungus**—consumed, it grants ten thousand years of immortality. Red clouds hover above it, with a purple cap, purple stem, and four stems lacking caps.

**Vermilion Fungus**—consumed, it grants a thousand years of immortality. It has a vermilion cap and a vermilion stem.

**Heavenly Might Fungus** is green, harvested and consumed in all seasons, granting ten thousand years of lifespan. Red clouds cover it above, with a green cap and a green stem.

**Evil-Repelling Fungus** grows in the sea, is green, and consumed, grants a thousand years of immortality. Its form resembles a human.

**Heavenly Cold Fungus** is yellow and human-shaped. Consumed, it grants a thousand years of immortality.

**Red Blossom Fungus** has a spicy flavor. Harvested and consumed in all seasons, it grants a lifespan of three thousand years. Two stems cross, one lacking a cap, one with a vermilion tip resembling an unopened flower.

**Heavenly Fungus**—harvested in all seasons, dried in the shade for a hundred days, and consumed in a *cun*-square piece, it grants immortality. It has a vermilion cap and a purple stem.

**Heavenly Land Fungus**—harvested with a bronze knife and consumed, it grants three thousand years of immortality. Two stems grow conjoined, vermilion in color, resembling an unopened lotus bud.

**Heavenly Gate Fungus**—consumed, it grants ten thousand years of immortality. Two stems grow conjoined, with a vermilion cap and a white sheath.

**Earth Essence Fungus** is guarded by two rams. Consuming the dew upon it grants six thousand years of immortality. Three stems grow conjoined, with a vermilion cap and a green stem.

**Sun Essence Fungus** has a sweet flavor. Harvested with a bamboo knife, dried in the shade for a hundred days, and consumed in a *cun*-square piece, it grants five thousand years of immortality. It is vermilion, with three stems lacking caps, all sharing a single stem.

**Moon Essence Fungus**—harvested in all seasons with a bamboo knife, consumed like a bean, it grants five thousand years of immortality. One person guards it, with a yellow cap and a yellow stem.

**Four Seasons Essence Fungus**—consuming its dew grants twenty thousand years of lifespan. Two green dragons guard it, it is red, and five-colored clouds cover it above. It has two layers, a vermilion cap, and a vermilion stem.

**Black Essence Fungus** has a sweet-sour flavor. Harvested with a bone knife and consumed, it grants two thousand years of immortality. Dried in the shade for a hundred days, two rams guard it below. It has a purple cap, a purple stem, and two leaves.

**Wood Essence Fungus** has a sweet flavor. Consumed, it grants two thousand years of immortality. Dried in the shade for a hundred days, three horses stand above it. Harvested with a bone knife, its cap is purple and curls upward.

**Water Essence Fungus** has a bitter flavor. Harvested in summer and consumed in pieces the size of a fingernail, it grants five thousand years of immortality. It has a green cap, with four stems piercing through the cap; if capless, the stem is white.

**Gold Essence Fungus** has a sweet flavor. Harvested with a wooden knife and consumed, it grants a thousand years of immortality. Dried in the shade for a hundred days, when eaten, it divides into five segments resembling rising flames. It is vermilion, with a single vermilion cap and vermilion stem. When the cap first emerges, the stem is green.

**Water Fungus** grows beside many waters and has a bitter flavor. Harvested in summer and consumed in pieces the size of a fingernail, it grants a hundred thousand years of immortality. Its cap is purple, with three points at the top; the stem is green, extending through without a cap.

**Rain Essence Fungus** grows in summer. It has a sweet flavor, and consuming any amount grants six thousand years of immortality. Its cap is green, with a purple stem, and four sprouts grow from it.

**Water Essence Fungus** grows beside mountain waters. It is greenish-black, with four branches growing together; the cap faces upward and has a slightly bitter flavor. Drinking its dew grants a hundred thousand years of immortality.

**Cloud Essence Fungus** grows on Mount Hua and has a sour flavor. Harvested with a bamboo knife, consuming any amount grants nine thousand years of immortality. Its cap is purple, and its stem is white.

**Tiger Essence Fungus** grows on the northern slopes of Mount Hua. It is yellow, resembling tiger skin, and has a sweet flavor. Consuming it prevents aging and grants keen intelligence and immortality. Its stem is vermilion.

**The Supreme Numinous Treasure’s Catalog of Fungal Varieties is complete.**

**The Supreme Numinous Treasure: Catalog of Sacred Fungi**

The art of prolonging life fundamentally relies upon consuming elixirs to attain longevity. As the *Book of Hidden Marvels* states: "The immortals command spirits." Thus, Guangchengzi dwelled upon Mount Kongtong, revealing the Dao and its governance to the Yellow Emperor. Chisongzi ascended the Kunlun Palace, ingesting *shuiyu* (water jade) to instruct the Flame Emperor. They roamed with wind and rain, ascending and descending to investigate subtle omens, traversing famous mountains, and observing flora—unveiling the mysteries of the obscure.

The forms of sacred fungi (*zhi*) are manifold, their myriad manifestations difficult to distinguish. Thus, illustrations were drawn, their appearances recorded, and their descriptions transmitted, that seekers might follow them to attain the path of immortality.

**Azure Jade Fungus** grows upon the mountains of Yangzhou. Its flavor is sweet and sour; consuming it grants twelve myriad years of life. Wang Ziqiao ate it and ascended as an immortal. A green tiger guards it. According to the illustration, it has four layers, with two branches on the second layer—its stem and cap are entirely azure.

**Cinnabar Jade Fungus** (also called *Zishi Fungus*) grows upon the mountains of Yuzhou. Its form is as depicted, and its flavor is bitter. Chisongzi consumed it and attained immortality. A red tiger and red fish guard it. According to the illustration, its stem and cap are crimson, with two layers. The lower layer bears two small fungi, and the upper layer has two small fungi, each with a cap.

**Yellow Jade Fungus** grows upon Mount Penglai. Its color is yellow, and its flavor is pungent. The Eastern King Father consumed it, attaining ninety thousand years of life and immortality. A yellow tiger and yellow fish guard it. It has three layers; the lower layer bears three branches, one of which produces nine caps. Its stem and cap are entirely yellow.

**White Jade Fungus** grows within Mount Fangzhang. Its flavor is pungent and white. It has four layers; on the lowest layer, two grow upward, and three grow upon the upper layer. It may also sprout upon great stones, in yellow sands, at the roots of rotting wood, beneath tall trees, or on the shady sides of famous mountains. Consuming it grants immortality. A white tiger guards it.

**Black Jade Fungus** grows within Mount Gui. Its flavor is sweet and sour. Xianyuzi consumed it and attained immortality. A black tiger guards it nearby, its form as depicted. It has two small branches growing in layers, its color black, with four layers—its stem and cap are both crimson.

**Five Thearchs’ Jade Fungus** grows within the renowned mountains of Songgao. It possesses five colors and five transformations corresponding to the Five Phases. Its flavor changes with the four seasons. Consuming it in accordance with the seasons grants ten thousand years of immortality. It has three layers; the lower two layers bear two opposing branches.

**Azure Thearch’s Jade Fungus** grows beneath great trees in famous mountains, veiled by yellow clouds. Its cap is azure, its lining crimson, its stem white, and its flavor sour. Harvested on *jiayi* days in spring and consumed, it grants ageless immortality.

**Cinnabar Thearch’s Jade Fungus** grows on the sunny sides of famous mountains. Its cap is crimson, its lining yellow, and its stem white. Red clouds hover above it, and its flavor is sweet and bitter. Harvested in summer and consumed, it grants four thousand years of immortality.

**Yellow Thearch’s Jade Fungus** grows atop famous mountains, above which five-colored clouds appear. Its cap is yellow, its stem white, and its flavor sweet and bitter. Consuming it banishes fear and grants thirty thousand years of life, attaining immortality.

**White Thearch’s Jade Fungus** grows between layered stones on the sunny sides of famous mountains. Its cap is white, its stem azure, and its lining black, with a sweet flavor. Consuming it grants three thousand years of immortality.

**Black Thearch’s Jade Fungus** grows within great valleys on the shady sides of famous mountains, veiled by black clouds. Its cap is black, its lining azure, and its stem yellow, with a sweet and sour flavor. Harvested in winter and consumed, it prevents aging and grants immortality.

**Eastern Fungus** grows within great valleys on the sunny sides of famous mountains. Its lining is azure and crimson, with two layers and a white cap. Its stem is azure, and its flavor is sour. Consuming it extends life to ten myriad years of immortality.

**Southern Fungus** grows on the sunny sides of famous mountains. It is crimson, with a crimson cap and stem, bearing three branches. Its flavor is bitter. Harvested with a bamboo knife, dried in the shade for a hundred days, and consumed in coin-sized portions, it grants thirty thousand years of immortality.

**Central Fungus** grows on the shady sides of famous mountains. Its cap is white, its stem yellow, and its lining black. Its branches resemble a single stem with a cap, two branches at the midpoint, their tips curling downward like suspended canopies. A yellow ram guards it. Harvested with a wooden knife and consumed, it grants immortality.

**Western Fungus** grows on the shady sides of famous mountains. Its cap is white, its lining black, and its stem azure, with three branches growing together. Its flavor is sweet and pungent. Consuming it grants ten thousand years of immortality.

**Northern Fungus** grows on the shady sides of famous mountains. Its cap is black, with three branches growing together from the stem. Its flavor is sweet and pleasant. Consuming it grants immortality—one who eats it will not drown in water, will not age, and will attain eighty myriad years of life. A black ox guards it.

**Stone Mortar Fungus** grows upon Mount Shaoshi, beneath red clouds, with yellow tigers guarding it on both sides. Its cap is crimson, its stem black, and it grows opposite the *Stone Jade Fungus*. To harvest it, one must fast and bathe for thirty days. When a rooster crows at dawn, the gatherer declares themselves *Tianzhai Jiangjun* (Heavenly Fasting General), dons colorful robes, and wears a dark crown and sash. Consuming a single *ge* (measure) grants sixty myriad years of life. (Alternatively, sixteen myriad years.)
